meta.article_title: April 15, 2013: Playing the Big Backhand Player

debutant.depth: Keep the ball deep on the table

intermediaire.play_forehand_then_backhand: Draw them out to their forehand side, then make them play backhands

intermediaire.first_attack: Get a good first attack (deep on the table)

intermediaire.attack_middle: Make the opponent move side to side by playing both wide and middle

avance.consistency: Keep the ball deep and consistent

avance.changing_spins: Find the spin they have the most trouble with, and place it deep on the table or go back and forth between loops and pushes

exercices_complementaires.description: Keep the ball deep on the table to reduce the opponent's options.
Play the forehand side to draw the opponent out of their backhand pocket.
Alternate between deep, spinny loops and deep, heavy pushes to force the opponent to adjust.
